summary: A Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 23, 2019, detailing an incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein reported a possible suicide attempt and alleged his cellmate had tried to kill him. The document contains statements from both Epstein and his cellmate regarding the events in their cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who reported a possible suicide attempt, alleging his cellmate tried to kill him. He is referred to as 'inmate Epstein' and is the central subject of the incident report.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: The officer who initially spoke with inmate Epstein after the reported incident and is mentioned in the cellmate's statement.

connections.description: Epstein reported the incident to the officer, and the officer is part of the staff Epstein's cellmate claimed 'wouldn't care' if Epstein was hurt.

events.title: Reported Suicide Attempt / Assault in MCC Cell
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein reported to Officer that his cellmate had attempted to kill him, with a string around his neck. The cellmate gave a conflicting account, stating he found Epstein sitting on the floor unresponsive after hearing a noise.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Westchester (mentioned in relation to the cellmate's court appearance)
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein reported to a correctional officer that his cellmate had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him.
Epstein's cellmate gave a different account, stating he found Epstein sitting on the floor, unresponsive, with a string around his neck after hearing a noise.
The cellmate claimed he had been told that if he hurt Epstein, the staff 'wouldn't care'.
The cellmate made racist remarks about an officer and commented on Epstein's wealth, noting a Daily News article with Epstein's picture that stated he was 'worth seven' (presumably billion).
The document records conflicting narratives about a critical incident involving Epstein in custody weeks before his death.
